Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: C0uplefr0mCardiff
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here while visiting our daughter. We enjoyed our stay, from arrival to departure - easy check-in with attentive, pleasant staff. Our en-suite room was very spacious with a huge bathroom. Lovely, clean public areas. Breakfast was great, the casual dining room was good and the Albufera restaurant was worth a try. Location was good - just north of the centre - a block away from the Estadio Bernebeu - where we watched Real Madrid versus Malaga - a fantastic experience. Took a bus one day, the metro another day to Puerto el Sol - very easy - both stops very near to the hotel. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel well maintained”
Reviews.Author: othello2000
Reviews.Content: If big hotels is your thing then go for it. Its well maintained but its not new. Our room was excellent in size (3 persons) and well equipped. I hate paying for wifi as i consider it basic amenity. Excellent and huge and efficient breakfast setup.

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Haris79
Reviews.Content: Good locatin if you need to be around the Santiago Bernabeu stadium but also near Cozco metro and taxis are also available outside the hotel at all times. Not very convenient for those who wish to spend their time in the centre and around plaza major or Cava Baja. The rooms are a little bit tired (please get rid of the old fashioned carpets) but generally comfortable and clean. We arrived as a big group for the Madrid - Apoel Champions League game but the hotel was very organised so that we checked-in in 5 minutes even though 150 people arrived at the same time. Excellent breakfast and freshly made orange juice is a big plus. Good selection of cheeses as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Spiewakowski
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Executive Suite and the outlook from the room was terrific. It was extremely quiet and our room was made up immediately whilst we were having breakfast just down the hall in a private location for customers on that floor. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful and they all spoke English as well. The meals were of a very high standard and cleanliness was to an extremely high standard. Our bed was so comfortable and the towels and sheets all had a lovely feel. I was sorry to leave. The location was right in the middle of Madrid with lots of excellent restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, but why charge for wi-fi as business hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Faan10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in March while on business. Nice and clean rooms and very comfortable bed. The hotel looks old and not very flattering from the outside, but is well maintained on the inside. Had everything necessary for business hotel, but charging EUR6 per hour for wi-fi was very disappointing. Tthe breakfast is very good, but charging EUR23 for breakfast is also a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linda N
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Madrid with my husband and we stayed at the Melia Castilla. It was an amazing trip and the hotel could not have been better. We splurged and stayed on the 15 th floor and the Royal Service was well worth the extra money! Having never traveled to Madrid, the concierge was my trip saver. Mercedes was the best! And the breakfast food and service was top notch! I miss Miguel and his espresso! I can't wait for my husband to need to go back to Madrid on business. We will definitely stay at the Melia Castilla again!

Reviews.Title: “What a breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: NoelGarry
Reviews.Content: I travel every week across Europe and I can honestly say that this is the best breakfast that I have had. It is an absolute banquet! Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the service”
Reviews.Author: Jodyquinn
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel with clean bright rooms and attentive service. WE had several nice meals at the Albufera restaurant. It was a bit far from the city center, but taxi wasn´t so expensive so we didn´t mind too much

Reviews.Title: “Superb staffs n services”
Reviews.Author: Asma I
Reviews.Content: Concierge,front desk officers to room service are really attentive. Very comfortable bed n good spread of breakfast to start your day. A free wireless Internet would be a plus point but sad to say it is not available for free. Taxi services are many, reasonable charge and trustworthy.Nearest metro is fifteen minutes away if you don't mind walking.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kito9
Reviews.Content: Have been there for a congress trip. Room a bit small but very clean (batroom was a pleasure), hotel, services, very good, and people very kind. Breakfast was nice in the normal restaurant, but did not enjoy at all when congress people was separated. I wonder why this was needed??

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Voyagian
Reviews.Content: I stayed a couple of nights in this hotel during a recent business trip. My room was clean and light. The breakfast buffet is excellent, the gym is ok with a couple of treadmills. You can use the wireless internet, but it costs. For my business purpose, the location is ok, but it's 7 km from the city's center. In general, I think it's a good hotel. But the service at the restaurant L´Albufera could be more professional.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly is tired”
Reviews.Author: dvdstv
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business with colleagues The entrance is reasonably impressive and the lobby/reception area strikes a good impression. However I do agree that it is rather tired The Melia has no walk in shower and the bath grout/sealer was stained and worn. Indeed the shower in the bath had been so badly fitted it pointed slightly to the right and it was difficult not to get water on the floor. Internet was charged and - worst of all - there was no facllity to make a cup of coffee in the room. When I asked about this I was told that this is not the UK and "Spain is different". If I was in a poor mood through missing my morning coffee that made it worse - 140 Euro a night and no cup of coffee on wake-up There was an ironing board - thats something at least - as I always appreciate the chance to smooth out suit-case crumpled shirts when I can. The safe was also big-enough for my laptop which is also a good thing But - for me this hotel does not understand the Business traveller - and as there are plenty of Hotels in Madrid - I'll be finding another for my return

Reviews.Title: “The perfect venue for mid-sized meetings”
Reviews.Author: style_uncompromised
Reviews.Content: I just had the pleasure to stay two nights at the Melia Castilla Hotel as part of a conference visit. Having visited more than a few similar places through my work over the years, I am delighted to share the Melia Castilla evolved as one of the real stars for mid-sized conferences. First, the hotel is highly accessible, being located only half an hour taxi away from the airport. Yet is has a inner city location. The initial impression was that the interior is perhaps a bit aged, indicating the hotel is not in the luxury league where everything has to be (or at least look) brand new. For the purpose of a good business trip, however, and certainly for a smaller conference, the hotel is still elegant from top to toe and absolutely superb in its category. It is also a pleasure to note that the high professionalism of the staff I met harmonised with the same high standards. Details which caught my attention included the excellent cleanliness everywhere, quiet (although small) rooms - in which you can even open the window to ventilate. However beware of traffic noise outside. The great breakfast buffet especially the meats and fruits section, and availability of elegant armchairs and couches in public areas. From a meeting point of view the plenary room for some 500 people was sophisticated and well equipped - all seats had microphones and own spotlights. The overall basement architecture (i.e. the meeting area) had the same elegance as the rest of the hotel, including top service. I personally liked the compartmentalisation of the meeting area, making it interesting and enjoyable to walk around between meeting rooms. Best of all, after the conference day you just take the lift up to your room. Anyone who has been to major congresses, with sometimes miles to walk from their hotels, will love this asset. Last but not least, there are multiple stylish board rooms in well secluded sections for confidential and undisturbed team meetings. Again, if you have experienced team rooms in venues with background noise from next door ongoing lectures, you will really appreciate this place. It is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and in an Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rolando G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well deserving of a top rating. I travel to Madrid at least 4 times a year on business and every time I stay at any of the Melia hotels, I get top notch service and amenities. I also enjoy its superb location within walking distance to the metro, a great variety of restaurants, and little local tapas bars. The staff is well trained and very friendly to accommodate and/or answer any question you may have regarding the city, customs, etc. I also enjoy the Breakfast buffet in the main lobby to star my busy day with a great variety of food. I will recommend this hotel chain to friends and business partners!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its good ranking!”
Reviews.Author: elydia
Reviews.Content: Melia Castilla is an excellent flagship of the Melia business hotels. It is huge, but staff is highly professional and still very friendly and attentive. My (Premium) room was large and comfortable and very quiet, beds were of the type you get in and feel comfy. Great shower, and spongy towels, everything impeccably clean. Breakfast offers something for every taste. Definitely a place to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: fabiano_ffaustino
Reviews.Content: The hotel has all the amenities expected for a place at this level and it is really well located in calm and nice neighborhood. It is short distance to subway as well to the Real Madrid Stadium (Santiago Bernabeú). Don´t miss the restaurant La Albufera for a real Paella. Breakfast buffet is also a really good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Really good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Chevan-cjp
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and soft nice corridores to the rooms. Everything in the hotell feels soft and thus it's really low in volume. No nice from inside or outside. Close to the Metro and about 30 min to station Sol where the nightlife if. Next door to bernabeu so for the Real fans this is the hotel to stay at, 3 min walk. Conf. Center Worms well and the breakfast is ackordens to standard.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: teamcoey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Castilla at a conference and found the hotel to be very comfortable and the staff friendly and helpful. The conference facilities were excellent and the hotel itself beautiful. My room was large and clean and had everything I needed other than free Wifi which was a little annoying. The hotel was quite far from the centre of Madrid so I would suggest a hotel nearer to middle of town if you were going for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “safe bet”
Reviews.Author: g-drako
Reviews.Content: Very good option if you have to be around Cuzco. All time classic spanish hospitality, with good service and enough english speaking staff. Standard rooms rather small, executive and premium are OK. However, no fitness room and wi fi charges ... A renovation would not be a bad idea.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the Comfy Bed; Stay for the Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: LAPlatinum
Reviews.Content: After a long flight with delays and lost luggage, I was cranky and exhausted, but when I arrived at Melia with my older daughter we found beds that felt like clouds. We were staying at Melia for a conference and I did love the place--the room was beautiful, if a little small, the bath amenities very nice (not quite L'Occitane, but very good), and prompt service from anyone and everyone. The conference facilities were great and very convenient. Water on the tables, pens, paper--all the usual things you expect. We really did love the breakfast buffet. I stay at many hotels whose prices include breakfast, and this was one of the top ones anywhere. Station after station with fresh breads and pastries of every sort; a vast array of cold meats and cheeses and smoked fish; many types of fruit; hot dishes of all sorts; and fresh omlettes to order. Fresh squeezed oj and Cava if you wanted a mimosa. If you are accustomed to "pigs on parade" at buffets, where everyone scarfs all the food and there is none left, you can forget about this malady at Melia. What was most astounding was that regardless of how close it was to the end of the meal time, the staff kept refreshing the platters. The most expensive cheeses and jamon were always replenished and you could not begin to try everything available. Now, to my two complaints. First, every hotel that rips off its patrons for Internet needs a sound smack down. I am still seeing this at many high end hotels and it has got to stop. Internet is now as ubiquitous as ironing boards in rooms and business hotels should quit dumping on the patrons for this. Second, I did not appreciate that the price per night shot up for the days of the conference by 45 EUR additional. I have to say that this practice of not extending the lower rate to the conference attendees for the duration of the stay is not something I have seen anywhere I go. I travel all over the world for conferences and there are never two prices. Also, while many hotels do complimentary upgrades, if you wanted a larger room, you had to shell out yet another 30 EUR per night. Other than this, the distance from the action was not particularly troublesome since the Metro was close by. I love Madrid and will strongly consider staying again at Melia.

Reviews.Title: “look beyond the horizon”
Reviews.Author: emeles
Reviews.Content: on first view this hotel is very nice, excellent reception staff on arrival, room clean and comfortable and restaurants good and food on par but then when you look beyond the horizon you see chargeable wifi (no real today when even Mc D's give it free). Wifi is available in the restaurant free but the cards with a pin number to use all had expired (credit to the bar manager who tried but failed to find me a workable number. In the bed room on closer inspection it really needs a make over with signs of tiredness becoming clear. No alarm on TV (you have to use reception) and no english papers available (even if american format) The best bit - Breakfast was excellent but couldnt make up for the feeling the rest of the hotel and stay was below par for the money and expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrian_Martina
Reviews.Content: My last trip to Madrid has been great, specially due to the nice and professional people I found at the Melia Castilla. I felt really cared in all aspects. I will recomend this hotel not only for business, but also for a weekend for friends of family. The breakfast is fantastic, the restaurants great, specially La Albufera with nice rice dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in business district”
Reviews.Author: LukeFields
Reviews.Content: Stayed with them for 5 nights on business. Excellent breakfast buffet and some good lunches, even for the large group we where. Would stay with thema again on business, for a citytrip or vacation I would stay on walking distance from city center.

Reviews.Title: “The best service”
Reviews.Author: Sandra L
Reviews.Content: I have spent one week at the Servicio Real in the hotel Meliá Castilla in Madrid. I have spent a lot of time at the hotel and I just want to say thank you and to congratulate all the team for the outstanding service. The suite was really comfortable, peaceful and warm, I did have a perfect rest. The rooms have been recently refurbished and the decoration is brand new and very beautiful, much better than other 5 star hotel rooms that I do not wish to mention here. The room service was fantastic, both for breakfast and dinner. The private breakfast at the Servicio Real was also really relaxing and nice, as well as the lunch of dinner at the hotel own restaurant. I definitely had a great time and I am grateful to the hotel personnel as they have provided an excellent service all the time. I strongly recommend this hotel which presents an outstanding service and facilities and is centrally located in the Castellana axis, right in the CBD of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelchick05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet is excellent. It's a very large hotel fairly close to the stadium and the congress centre.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Breakfast Experience in Europe!”
Reviews.Author: malbahari
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, a Classic in Madrid keep serving the most complete and delicious buffet breakfast in Europe. Also ask for the new rooms a plus for this well located Melia property. Everytime that I have to stop in Madrid even for a few hours I stay at this nice Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near Plaza Castilla”
Reviews.Author: NickOceanNJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times on business (my last trip for 10 days) and this is a very nice upscale hotel with excellent service. The location is convenient near Plaza Castilla, many restaurants and bars, it is near the stadium, not far from the airport, and close to public transortation. Taxi line in front of the hotel is always ready with friendly doorman service to assist you. I enjoy coffee at the coffee bar each morning and service in general is very friendly and abundant. My only criticism is that the "Gym" is an empty room right now. Also, water pressure fluctuated during my stay and I had no cold water one morning (actually brown water came out!). This is the first time this has ever happened so hopefully it was construction in the area. I would definately reccomend this hotel. I will be back end of October on another business trip so I will update my review after this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gorper
Reviews.Content: If you're staying in the north end of Madrid, this is an attractive option. Less than a ten minute walk to the stadium with very clean and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: akashiwo2011
Reviews.Content: Good location near different public transport stops but at the same time quiet. Main facilities very good. Quite big room. Bed quality very good. Breakfast buffet excelent: high quality products and variety. The only drawback, the price. It deserves the 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: reatigger
Reviews.Content: We booked through booking.com with confusion over 3 beds, however no problem for hotel who upgraded us on arrival and gave us another room to wait in until our suite was ready. Very good stay, quiet room even at front of hotel due to quadruple glazing. Restaurant has good value lunch menu. Am writing this next to the pool (water was a bit cold!) Tip-free internet is available on level S-1 and pool area close to hotel (WiFi is charged in rooms) The hotel is 2 blocks from the Cuzco Metro, convenient for airport with one change at Nuevos Ministerios.

Reviews.Title: “Quality large hotel - high service levels”
Reviews.Author: normanblade
Reviews.Content: We have returned from a 5 day stay in the hotel and can highly recommend the hotel for its high quality of service, its very efficient and helpful staff and its wonderful breakfasts. My wife's 60th birthday was enhanced by the room upgrade and welcome tray we and our friends were given upon check-in. The hotel is large and although not new comprises many high quality features throughout. Bedroom comfort levels were also extremely high with spacious storage areas not usually found in business hotels. The postive aspects of a top business and conferencing hotel were evident throughout our stay - no waiting for lifts, always someone around for help, excellent desk and concierge service etc.. In terms of value for money in one of Europe's most fabulous capital cities, the Melia Castilla fully deserves its high ranking and even though it is located at the northern edge of the city access to the centre can be achieved in under 20 minutes using the city's superb metro and railway system. Exclusive and budget restaurants can be found within walking distance of the hotel but always remember 'when in Rome...' different eating habits and siesta times may confuse and the main holiday period can cause temporary closure of some establishments. The one downside to a great city break was the non-appearance of our return transfer taxi which necessitated an anxious call to the UK to sort out the problem - should not be necessary - Bookings.com need to sort their Spanish agents communications out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Great for the family.”
Reviews.Author: Schwags
Reviews.Content: Our criteria for Madrid was a "family" room and a pool. Hard to find, so we gambled on Melia Castilla and loved it. My family of four stayed in interconnecting rooms. The checkin was friendly. Our rooms were spacious. The facilities were great, especially the pool. The Concierge desk was always helpful with advice to find the very close laundromat, local barber and supermarket or postcards, stamp and post box. ATM in hotel. It wasn't in the heart of Madrid,but we didn't need it to be. It was close to two Metro lines for quick trip into city for Prado, Sol, Plaza Mayor, etc. And plenty of interesting eating options nearby if you wished. All up, we loved it. Thanks Melia Castilla. My only suggestion would be to keep the pool open longer in summer.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: anon007Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 13th floor with a view overlooking the pool and back of the hotel. The room was quiet, had air-con which was essential in July but the decor was a bit dated. Did not use the pool or on site restaurant. Unfortunately the pool was open from 12 midday to 8pm, which was limiting if out sightseeing or at conference during the day. The coffee bar in the lobby and it's staff were helpful and served good coffee. They serve a very good buffet breakfast (though you should order real coffee separately). On the down side, few staff spoke English, the location was not ideal for sightseeing but as this was a conference venue, the metro was only a short walk away and easily commutable. Taxis are easily available outside the hotel and throughout the city. This was my first visit to Madrid and I would highly recommend it as a wonderful relaxed and walkable city with excellent bars, restaurants and some notable cultural sites! Go soon and stay in the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel bad location”
Reviews.Author: ramiJordan
Reviews.Content: clean large rooms with efficient AC nice bathroom , overall luxorious hotel, but nothing to do in the surroundings except that you can reach Real madrid stadium after 20 minutes walk. Though breakfast was very nice, when lunch and dinner were arranged for us as a private group the food quantity and quality were extremely poor.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Get Much Better!”
Reviews.Author: Spanky9442
Reviews.Content: We travel to Spain every couple of years with friends. The last two trips we stayed at the Melia. I will simply say you just can't do much better. Great hotel, excellent breakfast, and a super location. We really enjoy the places to eat and drink in the local area, and have not had a taxi cab driver that did not know the hotel location in any of our stays. It is walking distance from Real Madrid Stadium. The other positive is the staff, simple the best help in town for a foreigner visiting Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for travelling in business”
Reviews.Author: xiv
Reviews.Content: I stayed here four nights in June while participating at a conference. The hotel was nice, very clean, and the rooms were huge, end the bed comfy! So were the bathrooms, as there were kind of two bathrooms in the room. The breakfast was lovely with really all sort of choices, and everything was marked according to how healthy/unhealthy they were. There were different sorts of fresh berries and fresh fruits every morning. There was a quite nice pool area there also, which I never reached to test out. The hotel is a big conference hotel, and quite a distance from the city center and the old town. Perhaps 30-40 minutes by taxi. There was a Metro station quite nearby, and one of the lines was straight to the old town. The Spanish staff working at hotel was very nice, but very unorganized, so you really need to have plenty of time when checking in and out e.g. I also missed an opportunity to make a cup of coffee in the room, and a free or at least cheaper Wireless network at the hotel. It was 240 Euro for 4 days. If I was staying in Madrid just for Holiday I think I would have stayed closer to the old city

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sit_traveller
Reviews.Content: Great room, good speedy service in the basserie and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilities and personal treat at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: jvegido
Reviews.Content: We have recently had a European scientific meetimg of about 50 persons .Everything was running smoothly.People enjoy the hotel facilities,the food and the atentions received were excellent I strongly recomment this hotel

Reviews.Title: “IT'S GOOD TO BE THE KING”
Reviews.Author: BEORMUND
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an oasis of calm in a very hot and busy Madrid, over a festive weekend. Faultless service from the moment we arrived. Nothing was too much trouble for Sr Alcalde, the General Manager and his team of very professional staff. Upgraded to executive level with complimentary food and drink served all day. Such a treat. However, an even better bonus, on returning to the hotel after a busy day of sightseeing, was to find an outdoor pool. Everything 5* and more in this stylish and sophisticated hotel. Outstanding buffet breakfast, choice of two other a la carte restaurants and impeccable concierge service. Direct Metro line into centre of town from Plaza Castilla, a 10 minute walk away. 11 stops and 25 minutes, door to door. All in all, a wonderful weekend. We would definitely return. Es asombroso.

Reviews.Title: “unless you really want a nice outdoor pool you might as well try somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Richard10024
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay there for the first night of our european trip as it seemed a safe choice in terms of amenities when we could be up at all hours given jet lag. They gave us one room and said the connecting room would be available soon. The person staying in that room ended up staying an extra night so we had to move room after we unpacked. It turns out the internet wasn't available at midnight as they were working on the servers. (They did provide credit against the added fee). When we checked out their were items on the bill which had nothing to do with anything we had charged. The hotel was about 4 long blocks walk from the metro station which was about 10-15 stops from various stations downtown Madrid. The outdoor pool was nice for an urban hotel. Reasonably large -with chairs and grass around the pool. One other note - when we asked for a dinner recommendation we were given a recommendation to a very touristy restaurant which my family ended up not eating in - after we had walked about 25 blocks to get there. The hotel beds were good. And they were accommodating on adding an extra mattress. I should add that the staff were all quite pleasant and professional.

Reviews.Title: “First ClassService and attention.”
Reviews.Author: williestewart
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Melia Castilla about twenty years ago and had the privilege of returning in May 2011 to a Business Conference with three hundred delegates. I wondered if the high standards I experienced the first time would still be present and I am happy to confirm that if anything the Castilla is operating to an even higher standard. The restaurants were efficient and the food was good. The rooms are spacious and well maintained with excellent room service. All in all a very good choice for both the business and leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good business hotel, not central enough for tourists”
Reviews.Author: mehero
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty OK hotel for a conference or business trip. The lobbies, restaurants and lounges were comfortable and inviting. The staff I came into contact with were all helpful and efficient. My room was large, clean, well-furnished, comfortable. Bathroom was good, decent shower, clean and looked recently re-done. Hotel did not supply any weird lotions, only soap, shampoo and shower gel, also emergency packs for toothbrush / razor / shoesponge / comb. Desk/Dressing table, one armchair and one desk chair, lots of lights, mirrors, and places to put things, big safe, minibar well stocked. Efficient housekeeping: they had a "pillow menu", so I rang and asked for a feather pillow to be left while I went out and when I got back it was there. Our conference buffet breakfast was not in the main dining room so I can't say what it is normally like, but we had a wide choice hot and cold, including several options which were obviously local (stew?). No fried or boiled eggs, only scrambled, and the tea was (predictably) weak. The hotels has lots of steps and stairs, 3 here, 5 there, lots of little ups and downs but has supplied ramps next to most of them. The location is boring, and there is pretty much nothing to see within walking distance apart from Real Madrid's stadium quite a long walk away. I didn't try the metro, but a taxi from the city centre cost Euro 11. Apparently this is a growing business district.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EthelLancashire
Reviews.Content: The Melia Castila is an excellent hotel we couldnt fault the staff, rooms or food and both of us enjoyed our three night stay. If you are sight seeing in Madrid the hotel is not in the centre but the metro is really easy and only a short walking distance. There are a few restaurants around the hotel as well. I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “OK but wouldn't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: sally4holidays
Reviews.Content: On finally checking into our room we found a condom floating in the toilet and used towels on the floor etc so not a good start. Room was a decent size and the bed was comfy. Iron and ironing board in the wardrobe - but a fat back tv, no kettle or tea making facilities (5 euros to hire a kettle), no free internet....not what you would expect of a 5* hotel. Intended to make the most of a couple of hours down time by sitting in the sun by the pool but there were no chairs / beds etc. On asking at reception if we could have a couple of chairs we were told NO that we couldn't go round the pool as it hadn't been checked.....great ! Breakfast was pretty awful.....stewed tea, cold hot food etc Check out is a long process allow at least 30 minutes as the queue was very long

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the Bernabeu Stadium”
Reviews.Author: SpursfanN17
Reviews.Content: Modern, smart, clean Hotel 20 mins from airport and 15 mins from Real Madrids stadium

Reviews.Title: “Big and Old”
Reviews.Author: PHILIPMARSHALL
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights for a business conference. I would not book this for a personal visit, but it did work well for the conference. Positives: 1) Clean. All areas of the hotel were clean. 2) Extensive breakfast selection. Good service. 3) Reasonable size rooms, powerful shower and plenty of hot water. 4) 20mins from the airport by taxi. Negatives: 1) Very large hotel...not very personal....and old. It felt like being in a hotel from 30 years ago. It was clean and reasonably well maintained though. 2) No gymnasium or health options, which is strange when you consider the size of the hotel and the fact it appears set-up for business events. 3) Check-out was slow....not sure if the systems are 30 years old but it did appear to take the people a long time to process an invoice, etc.

Reviews.Title: “On par with the Breakers in Palm Beach Florida in regards to service.”
Reviews.Author: carock2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel from online pictures and reviews. It was an accurate description! My daughter is studying in Madrid this semester and I wanted to be close to her location. It turned out to be 3 metro stops away, but I would not trade out stay for anything! We stayed in a junior suite on the 15th floor. We had breakfast in the morning and wine, tapas and cocktails in the evening when we returned. That was a pleasant surprise. Here's a special commendation to Emilio on the 15th floor. His dinner and tapas suggestions were outstanding! And all in walking distance from the hotel. I felt safe ad pampered in this hotel and if I return to Madrid, this is where I will stay! A wonderful 6 day experience!

Reviews.Title: “Too far from "old" Madrid”
Reviews.Author: LB_Caledon_ONCanada
Reviews.Content: Too far from the city center. Also, the L’Albufera restaurant is overpriced and wait staff are not very nice. There weren't many people at the restaurant and those that were there were all placed in an area that had garden tables, chairs and umbrellas (I don't understand the umbrellas indoors). We were last couple in the restaurant and even before the dessert arrived the music was turned off and the wait staff decided to have a noisy conversation next to our table. The hotel rooms are large and clean. It is in the financial district, however if you plan on strolling through Madrid to see the sights, this is not a good choice. Also, parking fee is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “It´s a nice hotel with a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: jesutw
Reviews.Content: Well !!! We was very happy to find a hotel like this in Madrid, in the citry financial center, very close to many interesting paces to visit. We decide to stay in this hotel, becouse it has a good location, and in your free time you can visit some historical places, go to shopping, or just to walk. Also we need to mention that the hotel has very good service, and the personal is very firendly, We want to said thank you everyone for your good service, help, and colaboration.

Reviews.Title: “Proffesionalism and quality service”
Reviews.Author: SUSANA7204
Reviews.Content: It is an incredible hotel. Very good location for business and very well connected to city centre for leisure. The staff is really professional and helpful from the check-in to the check-out. The best breakfast buffet Excellent experience. Fully recommended. Enjoy your trip in Madrid. I did.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: rdguezp
Reviews.Content: It is a huge hotel but still excelent service where staff makes you feel unique meeting your needs.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent hotel and service on the Executive floor”
Reviews.Author: Kalu29
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot for business but our recent stay at this hotel was a wonderful surprise, and one of the best ever. Although I was familiar with the hotel brand from other travels, I had never had the chance to stay at one of their properties. Thus, we were not sure of what to expect, but were very pleased with our choice. The people were very friendly and helpful; the room was very beautiful and comfortable, the breakfast on the executive floor was very good and the ambiance very peaceful and pleasant. We would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: JBS-Spain
Reviews.Content: Friendly and efficient service, confortable and well furnished rooms, very good business facilities and one of the best breakfast buffets i have ever seen. I have been staying in this hotel for many years when going to Madrid and I will continue doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Many Problems”
Reviews.Author: hgg607
Reviews.Content: Had heard that the location was bad but it wasnt. There is a Metro stop 2 blocks away. It is in the Financial District of Madrid so many things are closed or have limited hours on weekends, but there were plenty of markets and restaurants. If you book through a discount provider and not direct you wont get their real five star rooms... its more like a four. I had to move rooms 5 times to find a room with one bed, internet that worked, no construction above... and I still had issues with the bathroom phone beeping throughout the day (until I had to physically remove it.) Also the water in the room turned orange and had sediment in it on the 2nd day.(they claim due to the hotel not being full... though I am not sure why that would happen 48 hrs after check in) All in all the price was really good (I didnt get the breakfast as it was a third of the price of the room!!!). Many airline staff stay here and that is always a good sign... means its quality at a good price. Because of the inconvenience of moving rooms so many times they upgraded me to what was really a 5 star hotel. (Had more than 2 pillows on the bed, wifi and even had better toiletries/robes). No hair conditioner though! Very strange! Pool was very nice. It is in a bit of a red light district though. I wasnt bothered by it, but would like to have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel away from City Centre”
Reviews.Author: David777
Reviews.Content: Convenient hotel if you have business in the northern suburbs of Madrid but quite a taxi/metro ride into the city centre so wouldn't recommend it for first time visitors to the city. Typical Spanish hotel with large rooms although the taste in decoration takes a bit of getting used to. Good outdoor pool but unheated and very basic changing facilities. Quiet location which I was pleased about as we arrived on the night of Spain's world cup victory!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, very firendly people.”
Reviews.Author: LVCCW
Reviews.Content: The service is one of the best I know in Madrid. Very quiet rooms, cozy and roomy. The breakfast and the restaurant are excellent. The people are the best exponent of Spain style. Thanks a Lots.

Reviews.Title: “Good property to stay in a quiet location but a bit away from the City centre”
Reviews.Author: indiantraveller61
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Melia Castilla with my spouse for 4 days. I was attending a congress at the IFEMA Congress centre which was a bit far but accessible by Metro. The nearest metro station is a 5 minutes walk away. The room was comfortable and very clean. There was a mini fridge and a safe too. They had a facility for paid high speed internet in the room. House keeping service was good. They had a lovely buffet breakfast with an option for both Buffet and Continental breakfasts. Overall a good experience

Reviews.Title: “The Set of Scarface”
Reviews.Author: CoolBreeze2010
Reviews.Content: That's how this place is decorated. I'm talking gold leafing and red carpet everywhere. The elevator walls are completely mirrored. It also didn't help that you had to walk through a metal detector each time you re-entered the hotel and there were always cops hanging out in front (I stayed for a week - this was my experience the entire time). I don't know how this place has been ranked as a 5 star hotel...the rooms are small, the room service options are poor, there are no extra pillows in the room, the staff was stand-offish if not rude, the bathrooms are less than spectacular - my sink dripped all night for the first evening I was there. Perhaps all of this is to prevent you from sleeping too soundly - you have to be on alert to protect yourself from the Tony Montana's who I infer from the metal detector, attempt to bring their "little friends" in all the time. Unless you enjoy the rush that comes with wondering if your door is about to be broken down by Al Pacino, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dugo_selo
Reviews.Content: Due to a congress, I had the chance to stay at the Melia Castilla Hotel and was not expecting nothing exciting, however my expections exceeded in many ways. All the meeting facilities, including the great Auditorium they have are just amazing. Allthough the hotel is classi and traditional the staff were just so helpful, from the reception to the concierge desk....and I think, that in this hotel there is always something going on, therefore I sincerely can only recommed this facility for any business travellers....simply a geat experience which I can recommend....

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL IN MADRID, CONFIRMED”
Reviews.Author: hugohernandez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second time. The staff was charming and attentive. Very clean areas and the rooms were remodeled new. The shower has 3 streams plus massage. The bed was new, plush and luxurious. You have to think twice to get out of the bed in the morning. The breakfast buffet has everything - highly reccomended. A chef prepares ommelettes to your taste, plus all the cold cuts, chistorra, breads and eggs you can imagine. Fresh sweet orange juice machine always ready. Near the Cuzco metro station, lots of tapas bars nearby to suit your taste.

Reviews.Title: “It is a 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: PPCLisbon
Reviews.Content: Staid with a group of 7 including 1 teen and 1 child. We booked 3 rooms and overall opinion was that all rooms were very comfortable, large and with nice decor. The hotel is really big and despite other reviews we found it very nice regarding the decor. Check in is a bit slow as we had to fill and sign 2 forms. But nothing to justify a big fuss. Staff is very polite but still friendly as expected in a 5 stars. We dined at L'Albufera and found it expensive (40 € / person) considering the quality of the food and service. Melia Castilla is far from downtown (if you consider the distance to Puerta del Sol) but still suitable for us as we were just passing by Madrid. Parking is better on the street as the hotel has a parking but very expensive. The best is the fabulous breakfast! The range of choices from cooked food till fruits, juices, breads, cakes, etc. and the quality is superior. Well above the most of other 5 stars. * The best: Rooms, breakfast, decor. * The worst: Restaurant L'Albufera (even the famous paella was very poor), expensive parking. * Overall: It is a 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Cautious_explorer
Reviews.Content: If you are booked in because your conference organiser got a good deal, try to make the best of a bad job. If that's not the reason, go somewhere else. This is a soulless great lump of a place, which must make its money out of captive conferences. It may have been smart once, but it is now careworn and, frankly, dowdy. Service is medicore, except for breakfast at which it is gruff (and all they have to do is bring you coffee and clear the plates: for the rest you serve yourself. But if you tire of waiting for coffee and go help yourself, there will be roars of disapproval). It's too far from the city (though the metro is five minutes' walk), and as Madrid is a very fine place indeed, you owe it to yourself to find a nice hotel. This is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but big and old fashion”
Reviews.Author: JIPD
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, beds was comfortable. The worst part was the air conditioning, it was very loud, and difficult to control the room temperatura. Either off or too hot. The Bathroom needs a renovation. Breakfast was very good. Nevertheless the hotel is fine in his kind.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: a_traveler54
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a few nights in January 2010. I can't really complain about anything---the room was completely fine, the bed was reasonably comfortable, and there were no problems in the bathroom. On the other hand, there wasn't really anything particularly great or distinctive about the hotel. Breakfast was fine. The location is only so-so, also. There's nothing of interest nearby the hotel, but it's reasonably close to a metro stop and the metro is easy to use and will get you anywhere. There were only two real negatives, and they were minor: The tv was old, small, and didn't work that well. And the internet connection was slow. All in all, I probably wouldn't stay there again, unless there was a particularly good deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Sussilago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night in july,driving through Spain towards Cadiz.This hotel should have on the most 4 stars,perhaps only 3 . Chech in was VERY slow,should be quick as presenting a Melia Mas card,with all personal details.Front desk staff-stiff. There was no extra pillows in the room,no robes,no slippers,no special amenities that you normally find in a 5 star hotel By breakfast the waiter brought coffee to the table,did not serve it,just left it and went away.,not even saying good morning.I then called him,and said that I do not drink coffe and wanted tea-he said-serve your self over there and left.Is tha<t the service you should get at a 5-star hotel?Then checking out I saw that they had charged the bill to my Visa card upon arrival.Normally you leave the card as a security when you arrive and the charge is done when you leave.Very unpolite to do it this way-are they afraid that you leave without paying? Come on Melia-service is lacking more and more in you hotels.I look for another hotel next time in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't really leave an impression”
Reviews.Author: rarchy
Reviews.Content: The Melia Castilla is nothing special. I like the old antiquey style it has, with traditional style furnishings and decoration. When you enter the hotel it has quite nice feel to it in the lobby, and the large well furnished corridors make it look and feel like a 5*, but the feeling ends there. Room: It wasn't particularly impressive, decor is quite nice, though it has a feel or having not been renovated in a while. It was pretty small, and felt squashed. The bathroom was the major let down, I expect more in a 5 star, and really it was old and dingy with poor lighting and not very impressive toiletries. Service: I don't remember being blown away, but nor being disappointed Food: I ate in the restaurant (not sure if there is more than 1) - it was quite nice, nothing amazing. Room service wasn't extensive. Breakfast was a surreal experience, the room is all yellow, with mirrors all around (I can't remember if there were even some on the ceiling). It kind of felt like something from a dream! The food on offer was ok, quite a large choice if I remember correctly. I wouldn't choose to stay here again as there are probably much nicer hotels in Madrid, really for a 5* this hotel is disappointing, I think they need to look at how they can reinvigorate it

Reviews.Title: “Getting old...”
Reviews.Author: MissFernweh
Reviews.Content: Even though this is a 5-star hotel you can tell that it needs renovation. It's easy to reach from the airport with a taxi, only a 15-20 minutes drive (cost about 25 euros). The bathtub was looking so old that you prefer just to take a shower but not a bath. The rooms are clean. For leisure I would choose a hotel that is more in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great food and excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: rjmacf
Reviews.Content: This a hotel I first stayed in nearly twenty years ago. I was concerned that it might be a bit frayed after this time. I was wrong. This hotel has a good standard of decor and is very clean. The rooms are much better than I recalled. They are very large and the beds are firm but comfortable. The black out curtains are very effective. Perhaps one pillow is a bit low for most. I was fortunate to have a first floor room which was super as the wi fi from the conference halls extended up to this level. Thus I did not need to buy the ethernet cable in the minibar. With the strength of the euro the minibar prices are pretty awful. 15 euros for three cokes is really outrageous but every traveller should know to go out and buy snacks in the nearest seven eleven. This hotel is central but Madrid is a big city. It is a long walk to the Prado although the metro is very good. In the area of Melia Castila the main buildings are apartments or banks. There are very few places to eat or any obvious supermarkets. Spanish is a dominant language even in the capital and you need to speak to someone below 30 if your main travel language is English. Madrid is a typical Mediterranean city witha very long part ofthe day where every facility closes. Unlike France it tends to last longer and most businesses and the traffic only pick up again at 5pm. The traffic is horrendous and I wouldn't hire a car in Madrid. You only need to look at all the dents and some of the driving! For Madrid in business or pleasure this is a great choice. At 163 Euros per night it is not cheap but worth the price. The food is simply delicious from breakfast lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Dark & unloved”
Reviews.Author: OrvistheDog
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as part of a large conference in June. The conference rooms were pretty good but the rest of the hotel failed to live up to its billing. The rooms were dark and unloved and certainly not good enough for a hotel at this price level. There was an air of dustiness about the corridors and an odd lounge near the lifts which looked like it had not been sat in for many years. Most disappointing of all was the pool however. It is unheated and, admittedly early in the season, in too dark a spot to get warm - I've had warmer swims in the sea around England. If you're coming here for a conference try and stay in another hotel nearby - there seem to be plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly and Tacky and Ugly”
Reviews.Author: SusyPape
Reviews.Content: If you want a three stars hotel for a price of a five, this is your place. Terrible smell in the rooms to not mention the bar: get in for five minutes and you'll smell cigarette for the rest of your stay. Air conditioning is in fact air at one condition: hot as hell. No way to change it. Room Amenities: the same you can find in a cheap Angolan motel, obviously forget robes and slippers. The Lobby has a kind of Cinderella syndrome: after midnight the hotel switch off the lights: is time to bed. Do you want a drink? no way, you are not allow to drink in the lobby: if you want to have some drinks you must stay at this stinky little tacky bar crowed of clients. But they do of their best to make of this place a nice classy five stars hotel with some decorations: plastic flowers. The is also an arcade with shops: same quality and variety of a Bulgarian shop during the iron curtain: may be interesting for an historian but not at all for a client. In a word: terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Melia Castilla is Nothing Special but Decent Value”
Reviews.Content: Location is fine, close to the metro and the bus line (#27) that will take you to the Prado. The rooms were small but reasonably clean. It was a fine experience but by no means 5 star or even 4 star. The food was about what you'd expect, nothing spectacular. No wireless in the rooms but they do have high speed wired internet that is free if you remember to bring a network cable. If not you can buy one from the mini-bar for ~7 Euros. We were here for a conference - they have a ton of conference rooms - so it worked out fine but I would never stay here for a vacation unless I got a good deal on a room. I would not pay more than $200 a night. Oh and the decor is very mid-1908's. Mirrors everywhere. Not updated at all.

Reviews.Title: “Sneering Staff; Bed of Granite; Hooker Surprise; Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WeakKnee
Reviews.Content: This was to be the capstone of our 2 week trip to Portugal and Spain. I treated us to a 5 star hotel in Spain; but the hotel is NOT 5 star quality. I had let the hotel know by email that we would be late and needed another bed and 2 twin beds, not a king. When we arrived, there was no one to retrieve our luggage and I had to park my own car (another insult was the $27 euro charge for 10 hours at the car park). I was traveling with my 26 year old son, 16 year old niece and me, a seasoned over 50 traveler. When I went to the desk, the staff ignored me (I'm a woman in Madrid after all). The room, although large and having a nice bathroom, had a king bed, not 2 twins (none were available) and the rollaway was much to small and very uncomfortable. But nothing compared to the bed of granite, it did not move when you sat on it. That might satisfy the monk or some one who travels with a bed board, but my back was in great pain the next day (my niece as well). Then, when we went out to dinner, there were hookers at every corner, yes they were upscale hookers (not scantily clad), but still I did not enjoy having to expose my niece to that experience (my son was approached by one the next day and they must have thought my niece was competition, since one of them told her to move on!). There is a great fish restaurant right down the block, however, where we had a lovely meal. When we returned, it was to discover that the internet is locked in the 20th century and there was no possibility of logging onto any sites (this was a common topic of communication with almost every english speaking guest). The next morning, I spent over 1.5 hours trying to get the staff to change our room, they kept on ignoring my requests, hanging up on me and then not answering the phone when we called the manager. I had discovered on the 2 minutes that I could get on line that the hotel had a newly refurbished area with latex mattresses. I finally had my husband call from the states and he alerted us around 1:00 pm that they had agreed to move us to the newer section of the hotel. We then enjoyed our day in Madrid (but with those painful backs), only to discover when we returned that not only had they not moved our room, but that they had done nothing. I must say that I lost it in the lobby, announcing to all and sundry that the hotel mistreated its guests. The manager finally then came up to me and sneering, he basically told me that nothing could be done (of course, it was now over midnight and too late to book another hotel). I wanted to leave but my son reminded me that it was only for one more night. What the hotel then did was give us around 15 pillows over the bed to sleep on. I will say that the pillow menu was nice. The manager had been sweating because I reminded him that having hookers across the hotel is not 5 star quality. He offered us drinks and we parted cordially. Overall, don't go if you enjoy the Marriott, Sheridan or Hilton type beds, comfy, but supportive. The beds in most of the hotel are major under par, as is the possibility of having to view hookers; on the plus side, the rooms are very large, well lit, clean, the bathrooms are very large, there are good toiletries, and the breakfast (included in the booking.com cost) was very expansive, delicious and they also made eggs for you on request. Do not park in the underground parking next to the hotel, it is rip off city. You can park on the street overnight, but have to get up early and move the car or feed the meter. If you rely on the Internet and don't have a fancy plan where you don't have to rely on the hotel supplied internet, this is not the hotel for you. It is about 10 minutes by car (I am a veteran NYC, Naples city driver) to the center of the city, in a generally good area. The swimming pool is an added plus (outdoors, not heated), but it is only open for a few hours and there is no fitness room. Booking.com got me a good rate, but in retrospect, I should have booked at the Hilton, free parking, free internet and great beds. Also, if your trip to Madrid will involve tapas, late night eats, shopping and museums, there are much better, but more expensive hotels in the centro, like the Westin Palace or the Urban. If I had not spent over $1200 on 3 nights in Pamplona, those would have been my choices.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but..”
Reviews.Author: Betosal
Reviews.Content: Good, but no five star!!!

Reviews.Title: “hidden extras”
Reviews.Author: Prioncias
Reviews.Content: This is a 3 star hotel rather than the 5 star it claims. But the room rate reflects this. The staff are friendly which makes up for the many inconveniences. No iron or tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. They charge rental for the iron and ironing board after the first 2 hours. They say on the website that internet access is free but you have to pay for use of the connection cable and you can make bets on how many towels house keeping will leave you.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: pabo99
Reviews.Content: I have been at the Melia Castilla for the second time. The first time it was chosen by a meeting organizer. I had to come to Madrid for a meeting with local colleagues and decided to return to the hotel. At both stays I enjoyed very much the spacious and comfortable rooms, where you can easily feel at home for your stay. Everything is very clean, every detail you may need for your stay is available in the room or the hotel (at least for me). Location is not bad, not for a tourist escape, but business wise quite well located. There are nevertheless some things that disturbed me: * The lobby is a kind of an airport check-in hall. To big and anonymous. So, don't expect luxury there. * I found that the beds were not that comfortable. * check your bill!!! Both times I was there, they added something to the bill. This time it was a movie that I didn't watch. I had to complain and at the end they called the director of the hotel who was very kind, removed the item from the bill, but asked me to pay more attention next time ...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: LAMATASBEST
Reviews.Content: Best hotel regarding quality, price and experience. Best breakfast salad and sweet. Smiles all over and very clean

Reviews.Title: “Pretty dire”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: Not good. Soul-less high rise out of the city centre. Poorly laid out, poor fixtures and fittings and terrible to average food. Bedrooms were a decent size and staff were ok but that is it I'm afraid. Bar drinks fabulously expensive from curt barstaff. Was there for a conference and so could not even escape the place. I breathed a huge sigh of relief when i went out of the front door for the very last time in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay, but not reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Bodysaba
Reviews.Content: I was in a Congress on 1st December and I stayed in this hotel. I was quite impressed with the installations and the big and confortable rooms, but it's the least you can expect from such an expensive hotel. Obviously, everything is nice and smart as it's supossed from a 5 stars hotel, but the staff is not at the same level. I am Spanish but I used to live abroad for a long time and I was embarrased with such a lack of manners of the waiters. A couple of Japanese guests were asking for a pot of coffee for 10 minutes and the waiter just shouted things like: "relax!!!"...and in Spanish!! The staff at the front desk is unable to say thanks or bye...and that characteristics of the rude Spanish that I thought was forgotten. In this hotel, it's still alive. Food is not bad and the location is just ok. I think it's a nice hotel but it does not worth the price you pay at all.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: sti5brigade
Reviews.Content: Stay in Madrid often and usually book at the last minute I have maybe stayed in 8 different hotels in Madrid in the last 2 years and only ever found one that was good (It was not this one!) but the Hotel AC Santa Maura Lets make sure everyone is aware that this hotel is not centrally located - its in the North of the city and a cab ride from the centre - it does though have the advantage of being in a relatively quieter location as a result You might not want to go wandering around at night as this area is what I can only describe as the Red Light District of Madrid - and therefore seedy. For this reason alone it gets downgraded - couples/women need to know as there may be safety issues? Hotel reception is large and ok. People there are fine. Rooms are dark, temparature control isnt ideal (i.e. doesnt work all the time), and the beds are not comfortable. I had difficulty obtaining a room with a double bed They have a cafe/restuarant that is open until late - avoid, the food and wine selection is poor as is the actual quality of the food The bar area is ok - seems in a time warp, prices are expensive for Madrid and It didnt have any ambience Breakfast is ok only I dont really like this hotel, its overpriced and poor quality overall - unfortunately for me there was little availability when I booked last minute (the fact that Melia was avaiable shows you either its a very large hotel or people know to stay away

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to the aura”
Reviews.Author: Akshi
Reviews.Content: Considering the five star ratings and the aura created around this hotel, we were mighty surprised that this one sure does not live up to its image. The reasons being: - Despite a global image, few of the basic staff cannot converse in anything but Spanish. - No bell boys to help you drag those luggage onto your room even if you spot few of them around. - No ironing board in room and if you get one, you are charged extra..this on top of the exorbitant room charge. - Breakfast menu leaves a lot to be desired for the money charged. All in all, this hotel is recommended only if your stay is paid by your company, otherwise it is not recommended. Plus points: Centrally located, good ambience and gentle staff.

Reviews.Title: “Classic - needing TLC”
Reviews.Author: skydriver
Reviews.Content: I'm going to try to take the bias out of this review, as I frequent Madrid. I have developed friendships and have a bit of an allegiance to this hotel. Pros: We are fortunate to stay on the 15th floor, also know as their Servicio Real. It is an additional 30euro per night over the rack rate. Included in the rate is an open bar at night on the floor, breakfast on the 15th floor and a dedicated receptionist as well. If you prefer, you can dine at the ample buffet downstairs, which is included with the price. The service is amazing. The staff is attentive, housekeeping is prompt, and everyone greets you. I don't know if this is a function of the 15th floor, but it seems consistent throughout the hotel. The beds are in good shape, fairly comfortable. Cons: No gym. I stay here a lot, and that is a huge frustration. You can walk one block to the Hotel Cuzco and use theirs for 7euro. I also have found a nice park to run in with chin-up bars fresh air not too far away either (run away from downtown on Castillana, past the new skyscrapers just built, and turn left at the hospital. In two blocks you will find a park entrance.) It is getting pretty tired; the luster is fading on this jewel. The carpets are showing wear, the decor and design are circa 1972. There is enough gold and mirrors in the lobby and restaurant to give you vertigo. To their credit .. the gold and mirrors are polished and spotless. The location is pretty removed. I don't mind the walk downtown, but it will take you 45 mins to get to the Plaza Mayor. On a nice day, there is nothing more relaxing ... and it is all downhill, but it is a hike. The Metro is sooo easy. 1euro per ride and the maps are not difficult to read (get off at Cuzco for the hotel). They are promising to remodel ... let's hope so.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 star hotel with the service and staff of a hostle”
Reviews.Author: juicylucy34
Reviews.Content: The Mellia Castilla hotel in Madrid......................We arrived on the 5th of July at about 7.00pm. We checked in and everything was great , we got a nice room and our bags were delivered to our room within 10 minutes. From then on unfortunately the stay in the hotel went down hill. We were only staying from the 5th until the 9th and to be honest we were happy to leave then as we did not feel comfortable at all staying there. We were on one occasion screamed at by pool staff across the pool. I had left my sunbed to go to my room and get something, as my towel had blown into the pool the life gaurd and pool attendant must of put my book between the mattress and the sun bed to make sure this did not blow in also. When i came back they saw me looking for my book, both of them proceeded to scream at me in spanish trying to tell me where the book was. Unfortunately i do not speak Spanish so i couldn't understand, they stood at the other side of the pool and screamed at me for a good 10 minutes, getting quite annoyed because i couldnt understand what they were trying to say, if they had simply walked around and showed me where they had but the book this would of be fine but at this stage the gentleman behind the bar started to scream also in spanish. It was obvious i couldnt understand and i was mortified as everyone else around the pool was looking at me, i had to leave the pool area. Eventually a guest with very little english in the pool told me that the meant the book was under the mattress. I was very embarrassed as they made me feel quite stupid, for a 5 star hotel this is not really they way i expect to be treated. On another occasion my friend took out grapes to eat on her sun lounger and another life gaurd came over and told us very abruptly to put them away as there was a sign saying "no eating". There was no sign anywhere around the pool first of all, no sign anywhere outside and i had seen 2 other Spanish people eat beside the pool, and i would be quite sure the pool staff had seen them also. He again had very very little English so i could not explain this to him. From then on the pool staff did nothing but stare at us and point at us throughout the time we sat around the pool. When we were leaving , a security gaurd hovered around us in reception while waiting for our taxi and walked beside my friend right through reception as if she was being ascourted out of the building. When i got outside with my bags, it was obvious we were struggling and my case fell down a few steps and i lost control, my friend dropped her bags to help me but not one of the 2 porters who were standing there beside us even tried to help. I wouldn't say i was expecting to much off the hotel and the fact it was 5 stars i would of thought they would of gone over and above to help or assist there guests. I found that the fact i didn't speak the language was a hindrance and this is why i could not point it out to management because i had no energy to try and have a conversation where they couldn't understand our language or point of view. I was a bit upset leaving , it was if we had acted quite rude towards them that they were doing the same with us. I am aware it is hard to communicate when you do not know the language but this was really not the problem. I really don't know what to say about this, i did find the hotel expensive but i fully understand this goes with a 5 star hotel and i wouldnt complain about that even though a can of coke at the pool was 6 euro and a mixed salad was 19 Euro. I wouldnt recommend this hotel, it is highly overpriced and the staff leave a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “A big dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: moontheodos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights [18-22 April 2007] First thing is that this is not a 5 star hotel [propably it was 10 years before but not now !!!] Second fact is that the metro station [Cuzco or Plaza DE Castilla ] is a little bit far ,when you arrive from a long journey and you carry the luggage [about 15 min walk ] The hotel is far from the center They gave us a double room [1130] that when we entered it was smelling awful [ moisture] Fortunately, we managed to move to another room [1044 ] The room was average in size and clean.The bathroom was small Breakfast was superb The staff was helpful but not at all smiley [they have to deal with many people ] Overall,not a good choice for a traveller that has to pay too much and has to walk too much!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Air Conditioning Until the Summer”
Reviews.Author: DrGonzalez
Reviews.Content: Have to warn all travelers to this Hotel that while my stay in April 07, they had no A/C the room temperature reached 90 F, when the Hotel Reception was questioned why warm air came through the ventilation vent, they simply answered that they only turn the AC on in the summer. I ask for a fan, they had none. Even with the windows open it was so hot, and then the city noise kept me up all night. Not a way to enjoy Madrid, before you book, check out the Hotel has a working A/C during the spring and fall.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: S&P-Together
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Castilla for 2 nights with a conference and overall the stay was not that great. The hotel has a grand entrance, however quite dated, similar to a Vegas casino from the 70s. The staff is not overally helpful. The rooms have peeling wallpaper and the first night due to an inoperable toilet we requested a room change. We were moved to a new room which was also in need of an upgrade. The rooms were rather noisy. Hotel is not in a good location for site seeing, etc. Too expensive for what you get. However the conference facilities are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Awfully arrogant!”
Reviews.Author: KEBnNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for a conference, and we regret it. The staff may be multi-lingual, but their arrogance and rudeness translates into any language. For example, we asked the concierge to please mail some postcards for us, and asked to pay him for the cost of the stamps; we found out later he got a nice little tip for himself out of it. When we called the front desk looking for an iron the night before conducting a formal presentation, they simply said no, with absolutely no effort toward problem-solving. As for the touted offerings of the Melia's various restaurants, we found them to be completely overpriced, at fully three times the rates of nice restaurants we had eaten in nearer to Madrid's city center. (The minibar offers $5 cans of soda!) From the Melia's location, Madrid's museums and evening-terraza fun are completely inaccessible without involving a 20 min. ride on the Metro subway. The local restaurants/tapas bars are not worth mentioning, which forces you to partake of the overpriced hotel-centered services. Won't stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth to be mentioned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It never deserved the 5 stars, more 4 star standard. The hotel is something from 1970, at least the rooms look like. The staff is very arrogant and not very helpful. Already in the first night one tupe broke down and the whole bathroom was under water. At least we could say that the breakfast was very good, plenty things to choose. It ssems that this 1000 bed hotel is being filled up with tourists during weekends to make it more rentable. Even as members of the Sol Melia Mas Program we felt being treatened like that. We had been in a lot of other Melia Hotels, mostly 4 stars. Each of them were much better than the Melia Castilla. For us the location was not that problem. Public transport ist very good, bus and metro stations very close and within 20 minutes you are in downtown. So, price is not everything! Better choose the AC Hotel 100 meters away. Germany, May 2nd 2006

Reviews.Title: “Genuine 5* hotel, wrong location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: griffjd
Reviews.Content: Great rooms at the Melia Castilla in the Northern part of Madrid. The hotel is located in a predominantly business areas of Madrid with eay access to both the airport and the city centre. Rooms are extremely well appointed and the multi-lingual staff are very helpful. Breakfast buffet was 20 Euros and had everything you could wish for from scrambled eggs to cold meats and pastries. I've stayed at this hotel 5 times now - always on business so the location dosen't realy matter. If you're in Madrid for the weekend though have a look at Melia and Trypp's other hotels nearer to the city centre. Good pool in summertime although its a bit cold. Remember that the pool is in a courtyard and is surrounded by high rises. In late afternoon the pool loses the sun completely. A genuine 5 star hotel but you won't get much change from 220 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but needs work”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Castilla for a conference the beginning of December. It has many of the amenitites you expect from a 5-star hotel, including a pillow menu! The rooms were very large and clean--as well as the bathrooms. The beds are very comfortable and the staff was friendly. The breakfast buffet was wonderful. My only complaints were the location -- the closest metro station is about 5 blocks, and the hotel lobby could use a facelift. For a hotel with so many rooms, the reception desk is very tiny--only space for about 4 employees to check-in guests. Most of the hotel decor is dated -- lots of mirrors -- reminds me of a 1970s Vegas casino...

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Rosebud9802
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Castilla with my mom and younger brother during spring break. I would suggest taking a taxi to and from the airport to the hotel because they to do not provide an airport shuttle. The approximate cost was 18-euros one way. This hotel was on the outskirts of Madrid. However, we walked about 5-blocks to the bus that you can hop off and on all day for one price, which includes stops at all the local attractions. The lobby of the Melia Castilla is large and includes everything from restaurants, a bar, stores, a travel agency, and hair salon. The entire staff was very helpful and friendly. The concierge were knowledgeable and guided us with the cheapest way to see the sights in Madrid. We were surprised to find out when we arrived that our rate included a buffet breakfast. The breakfast was large and the waiters went out of their way to be of assistance. The rooms were very clean and decent. Even though this hotel was not in the greatest location I would stay and recommend it to anybody traveling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel 5 star in a great location ..only 10 mins from downtown (6 euro in taxi)..15 mins airport(20 euro)...rooms were large and spotless as were bathrooms...nice swimming pool in garden....overall a great hotel ...i will be back and always recommend it.
